author: DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA
description: The Supreme Court has issued a warning to the Association for Democratic Reforms for making unsupported allegations regarding the Election Commission's methods in validating voter lists. During the proceedings against the legality of the Special Intensive Revision (SIR), the court encouraged a focus on legal frameworks rather than political posturing or speculative assertions about BLO suicides.
title: Bhushan calls EC a ‘despot’; argue within legal confines, SC tells him

author: MADAN KUMAR AND MANOJ CHAURASIA
title: Bihar: After bagging home department, BJP gets speaker’s post

author: TNN
title: Consider Kerala plea to extend SIR deadline, SC tells EC

author: SUBODH GHILDIYAL
title: Oppn feared loss of floor time, end of logjam brings relief

author: TNN
title: Parliament truce: Govt agrees to SIR debate on Dec 9; Rijiju blames oppn for logjam

author: MOHD DILSHAD
title: SIR row: Teacher on roll-revision duty dies in Hathras, toll touches 9 in UP

author: SRISHTI LAKHOTIA
title: Sunali branded an illegal but parents are on 2002 Bengal roll

author: VIMAL BHATIA
title: Rajasthan: Tank sinks in canal during Army drill; jawan killed

author: BHARTI JAIN
description: Political donations via electoral trusts reveal the BJP received a substantial Rs 959 crore in 2024-25, with the Tata group's Progressive Electoral Trust contributing Rs 757.6 crore. While Congress secured over Rs 313 crore through trusts, its overall contributions are significantly lower than bond receipts in previous years. Other parties also received smaller allocations.
title: BJP bags 83% of Rs 915cr routed via Tata Group-controlled trust

author: DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA
title: Illegal migrants have no legal rights, says SC; rejects ‘refugee’ tag for Rohingyas

author: KANGKAN KALITA
description: Tezpur University is experiencing significant unrest as students engage in protests, securing building entrances and calling for the dismissal of VC Shambhu Nath Singh due to allegations of misconduct and a lack of respect for student voices. Nearly all academic and administrative functions have ground to a halt, affecting a vast number of students.
title: Assam: Tezpur central varsity logjam continues; students shut down campus

author: PRASHANT RUPERA
description: Bharat Taxi is making waves across India as it gears up to launch its innovative driver-owned ride-hailing app nationwide. With an impressive roster of over 51,000 drivers in its pilot phase, this groundbreaking cooperative model stands as the first of its kind globally, ensuring that every fare goes directly to the drivers.
title: By the drivers, for the drivers: Bharat Taxi starts Delhi, Gujarat trials

author: MAHESH BUDDI
title: Hoax bomb threat: Hyderabad flight diverted to Mumbai; RGIA police registers a case

author: SWATI SHINDE GOLE
title: Indian scientists discover ancient galaxy ‘surprisingly similar to Milky Way’

author: PAWAN TIWARI
title: Parry wanted to quit crime, so Lawrence had him killed: Kin

author: TNN
title: RS sends Manipur GST bill to Lok Sabha amid walkout by oppn over SIR

author: TNN
description: Government clarifies users can uninstall the Sanchar Saathi app, despite mandatory pre-installation for manufacturers. Communications Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia assured the app protects against cyber fraud, refuting snooping concerns. Critics, including Congress, view it as an invasion of privacy, while global tech giants express alarm over potential security risks.
title: Sanchar Saathi row: Govt says users can delete app; Cong cries snooping

author: VAIBHAV GANJAPURE
description: The Bombay high court has halted the announcement of first-phase municipal poll results, scheduled for December 3rd. Justices Anil Kilor and Rajnish Vyas ruled that releasing these outcomes prematurely could unfairly influence the second phase of voting on December 20th. The court mandated that all results be declared together on December 21st, ensuring electoral fairness and transparency.
title: Defer Maharashtra civic pollsphase 1 results till Dec 21: High court

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Milwaukee Bucks fans are concerned as Giannis Antetokounmpo has significantly altered his social media, removing most team-related posts. This, coupled with the Bucks' poor season performance and recent losses, has fueled speculation about a potential trade. Despite past loyalty, the team's struggles and Giannis's desire for championships are raising alarms.
title: Giannis shocks fans with sudden social-media purge amid Bucks exit rumors

author: SAT SINGH
title: Haryana sports dept gives itself clean chit in deaths of teen basketballers

author: MAHIMA ROY
description: Stephen Curry revealed a pivotal moment from his early dating days with Ayesha, where she encouraged him to stay in school, solidifying his belief in her unwavering support. This heartwarming recollection comes amidst recent fan backlash over Ayesha's "Call Her Daddy" podcast comments, which some perceive as disrespectful to Stephen's commitment.
title: Stephen Curry shares the moment he knew Ayesha was ‘the one’ amid her remarks

author: NASEER GANAI
title: After 5 years, HC allows PDP legislator to travel within India

author: SANJAY KHAJURIA
title: Court frees CBI's catch in Rubaiya abduction case, cites charge-sheet gap

author: NASEER GANAI
description: Panic gripped Srinagar as a Himalayan black bear was sighted at the University of Kashmir and later at SKIMS hospital, nearly 10km apart. Wildlife officials are deploying traps and drones to capture the elusive animal. Increased sightings are attributed to climate change and readily available food sources like garbage, disrupting hibernation patterns.
title: Himalayan black bear enters Kashmir University, SKIMS; wildlife dept sets trap cages

author: NASEER GANAI
title: Omar's deputy Surinder Choudhary moves Delhi HC over audio 'sex tape' on social media

author: TIMESOFINDIA.COM
description: Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez are dialing up their commitment to philanthropy, unveiling a generous $102.5 million in grants via the Day 1 Family Fund to support 32 dedicated non-profits. Covering 20 states, Washington D.C., and Guam, these organizations are set to receive immediate assistance geared towards helping families emerge from homelessness into permanent housing.
title: Bezos & Sanchez’s charity: Day 1 Fund to donate $102m; 32 non-profits to get grants

author: SEHJAL GUPTA
description: Candace Owens claims French officials are using a minor spelling error to dismiss her serious allegations of a plot against Charlie Kirk and her own safety. She argues the focus on 'Riley' versus 'Ripley' distracts from her core claims about French Legionnaire involvement and questions about individuals present at a Utah event. Owens awaits a response from the FBI.
title: Candace Owens fires back after France rejects her Macron–Kirk claim over typo

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Delhi is grappling with alarming air quality, as the AQI spikes to 372, perilously close to the 'severe' classification. More than 15 areas have hit this alarming benchmark. Experts warn that this 'very poor' air pollution is likely to linger for several days, compounded by nightly patterns of mist and haze.
title: Delhi pollution nears 'severe' again: AQI rises to 372

author: RAJAT PANDIT
title: India to soon commission 3rd nuclear submarine with ballistic missiles: Navy chief

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The sole survivor of a Saudi bus accident, Mohammed Abdul Shoaib, recounted how a tanker struck their vehicle, causing it to erupt in flames and kill 45 passengers, including his family. He escaped through a window as the bus caught fire, but his clothes ignited. Shoaib, now without support, has appealed to the Telangana government for a job.
title: Saudi bus tragedy: Lone survivor recounts horror; pleads for support

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: IBM CEO Arvind Krishna attributes current tech layoffs to pandemic-era over-hiring, not AI, calling it a "natural correction." While acknowledging AI will cause some job displacement, he believes companies will ultimately hire more people in different roles as productivity increases. Krishna also stated IBM plans to hire more college graduates.
title: Tech layoffs: IBM CEO says job cuts not due to AI; blames overhiring in Covid years

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Dale Steyn anticipates a continued strong performance from Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma in the second ODI against South Africa. He also believes Quinton de Kock will be motivated to score big after a first-ball duck, highlighting his impressive recent form and strong record against India.
title: After Ranchi run-fest, what will Ro-Ko do in Raipur ODI? Former SA legend predicts

author: YASH SONKAR
description: The US has escalated its military presence in the Caribbean, deploying warships and aircraft near Venezuela, citing a war on narco-terrorism. However, the scale of the operation and questionable drug seizure data suggest a broader strategy aimed at regime change in Caracas.
title: Democracy, drugs or oil? Why Trump is gunning for Venezuela's Maduro - explained

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin stated Moscow is ready for conflict if Europe initiates it, accusing European governments of hindering peace efforts in Ukraine. US special envoy Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner are in Moscow to advance a peace plan, facing objections from European nations and Ukraine over territorial concessions and military limits.
title: Europe-Russia war? Putin says Moscow is 'ready' - what triggered shock remark

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Air India has issued a travel advisory urging passengers to confirm flight status before airport arrival due to a third-party system outage impacting check-in operations and causing widespread delays. The airline's teams are working to restore services and minimize passenger inconvenience. Travelers are advised to allow extra time for their journeys.
title: Glitch hits airports again: Check-ins affected; Air India asks flyers to check status

author: SEHJAL GUPTA
description: Twitch streamer Nina Lin has been banned for the third time, with the latest suspension occurring on December 2, 2025. This ban follows a viral video where viewers accused her of shoplifting from a Target store during a livestream. Her ambiguous response to the incident intensified online discussion and scrutiny.
title: Nina Lin banned on Twitch again after Target shoplifting clip goes viral

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: India secured a 17-run victory in the first ODI against South Africa, fueled by Virat Kohli's century and Rohit Sharma's fifty. However, off-field tensions regarding World Cup selections and unsettled team combinations persist as India prepares for the second ODI in Raipur.
title: Rohit-Virat in focus as India brace for Proteas fightback in Raipur

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Virat Kohli will feature in the Vijay Hazare Trophy starting December 24, marking his return to domestic cricket after over a decade.  DDCA president Rohan Jaitley confirmed his availability, anticipating a significant boost for the Delhi team.  This move follows his ODI hundred against South Africa and comes as domestic participation becomes compulsory for contracted players.
title: Virat Kohli to play in Vijay Hazare trophy after 15 years; DDCA confirms

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Instagram is mandating a full five-day work week in its US offices starting February 2, 2026, a significant shift aiming to boost creativity and competitiveness. Chief Adam Mosseri believes in-person collaboration is key, while also announcing operational changes like fewer meetings and more prototypes to streamline product development and foster a bolder culture.
title: Instagram's new office rules: 5 days in office; no more meetings

author: DR. ARATI KULKARNI SRIVASTAVA
description: Ravens tight end Mark Andrews faces relentless fan criticism for a past playoff fumble, even after a strong 2025 season. Despite his consistent performance and a recent engagement, online trolls continue to mock him, referencing the dropped pass. Andrews previously explained the incident was due to wet gloves, but the public's memory remains unforgiving.
title: Mark Andrews gets engaged to Elena Yates as fans troll him over Lamar drop

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: US Senator Bernie Sanders has sounded the alarm on America's medical debt crisis, revealing over 530,000 people face bankruptcy annually due to healthcare costs. He contrasts this with countries like Germany and Canada, which report zero medical bankruptcies. Sanders argues this financial ruin from illness is a moral and economic failure, advocating for Medicare for All.
title: Bankruptcy alert: Bernie Sanders warns Americans; over 5 lakh may be at risk

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Karnataka's chief ministerial post remains undecided as Siddaramaiah and Deputy CM D.K. Shivakumar's "breakfast diplomacy" yields no timeline from the party high command. Both leaders project unity, calling for a peaceful settlement amidst ongoing speculation. Siddaramaiah's cryptic "politics is not permanent" comment further fuels discussions about a potential leadership change.
title: CM Kar'nataka': Sidda, DKS make a meal of it; clean up left for Cong high command

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: A quick one-minute stair climb after eating can effectively lower blood sugar spikes. Research shows even brief periods of climbing stairs significantly reduce glucose levels. This simple exercise engages leg muscles to absorb sugar without relying on insulin. Physiologist Jose Tejero recommends this habit for metabolic health. It offers benefits beyond blood sugar control, aiding blood pressure and energy levels.
title: Diabetes Tips: Expert shares 60-second trick to quickly lower blood sugar levels

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: The Indian rupee hit an all-time low of 89.95 against the US dollar, driven by speculators and importers. Experts cite a strong dollar and delayed trade deal as key factors. While some foresee appreciation with a trade deal, others expect continued volatility around the 90-per-dollar mark.
title: Rupee tumbles to hit life-time low! Currency nears the 90 per dollar mark

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: India's Russian crude imports are set to dip following US sanctions on major oil firms, but a permanent shift is unlikely. Refiners are strategically sourcing from non-sanctioned Russian entities and other global suppliers. Despite temporary disruptions, India's demand for cost-effective Russian oil, coupled with emerging workarounds, suggests continued, albeit indirect, procurement.
title: Trump sanctions: Crude imports from Russia at a high - can it continue?

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: India has achieved a significant milestone in indigenous defence capabilities with a successful high-speed rocket-sled test of a fighter aircraft escape system. This dynamic trial, conducted by DRDO, validated canopy severance, ejection sequencing, and aircrew recovery, placing India among nations with advanced in-house testing. The test simulated real-life conditions, marking a step towards self-reliance in defence.
title: Watch: DRDO tests fighter jet ejection system; Rajnath Singh hails milestone

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Virat Kohli looked sharp and assertive, taking on throw-down experts Raghu (right-arm) and Nuwan Seneviratne (left-arm), who pushed the pace throughout the session. The battle was compelling to watch — Kohli found the middle of the bat repeatedly, though there were moments when Raghu’s extra pace beat him. Head coach Gautam Gambhir stood positioned between the two nets, observing the session closely.
title: What's brewing? Kohli ignores Gambhir, Rohit stops for a quick chat ahead of 2nd ODI

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Ranveer Singh’s action film 'Dhurandhar' releases on December 5, 2025. With a runtime of 214 minutes, it’s Bollywood’s longest film in two decades. The film received an 'A' certificate, includes toned-down violence and added disclaimers. Cast includes Sanjay Dutt, Sara Arjun, and directed by Aditya Dhar.
title: 'Dhurandhar': Film's final length 214 mins after CBFC trims violence and mutes bad words

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Fast bowler Harshit Rana dismissed claims of preferential treatment under head coach Gautam Gambhir, stating he focuses solely on his on-field performance. Rana, who debuted across formats during Gambhir's tenure, emphasized his commitment to hard work and avoiding external noise. He is actively working with bowling coach Morne Morkel and Arshdeep Singh to enhance his new-ball skills.
title: Does Harshit Rana get preferential treatment from Gambhir? Pacer breaks silence

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Google CEO Sundar Pichai actively monitors social media platforms like X on product launch days. He seeks unfiltered user feedback to understand real-world product reception. This hands-on approach complements internal data. Pichai's direct engagement helps assess what is working and what needs improvement for new launches like Gemini AI models.
title: Gemini 3.0 launch: Google CEO explains how he measures products’ success - what he said

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Madison Beer celebrated her mother's birthday at a Chargers game, transforming a suite into a festive event. Meanwhile, quarterback Justin Herbert showcased remarkable grit, playing through a broken hand to lead the Chargers to victory. His performance and Beer's family presence fuel speculation about their strengthening relationship as the Chargers push for the playoffs.
title: Madison Beer turns Chargers’ win into birthday celebration as Herbert battles injury

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Russia's State Duma has ratified a major military logistics pact with India, the Reciprocal Exchange of Logistic Support (RELOS). This agreement allows both nations' military forces to utilize each other's facilities for joint exercises, humanitarian operations, and disaster relief, strengthening their strategic partnership ahead of President Putin's visit.
title: Military pact: Russia opens ports, airspace to Indian warships & planes; what it means

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma showcased impressive form in training ahead of the second ODI against South Africa in Raipur. Following a thrilling 17-run victory in Ranchi, where the duo starred with a century and a sixes record respectively, India aims to extend their series lead.
title: Ro-Ko mania hits Raipur! Virat Kohli goes big, Rohit Sharma takes notes - WATCH

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: SoftBank's Masayoshi Son revealed he 'was crying' while selling Nvidia shares, a painful but necessary move to fund AI ventures like OpenAI. Despite the emotional toll, Son emphasized the critical need for capital for future AI investments, dismissing concerns about an AI bubble and predicting its immense long-term economic impact.
title: SoftBank founder says he was ‘crying’ while offloading Nvidia stake — here’s why

author: CHETHAN KUMAR
description: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla reflects on his ISS mission, highlighting its success as a model of international cooperation and scientific advancement. His insights offer valuable lessons for India's own long-term human spaceflight strategy, emphasizing modularity, flexibility, and clear objectives for the upcoming Bharatiya Antariksh Station.
title: 'Space teaches you to adapt': Grp Cpt Shukla on what ISS got right, what India can learn

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Bharatiya Janata Party has responded to Congress accusations regarding the Sanchar Saathi app. BJP leaders stated the app aims to protect users from fraud and crime, not to monitor them. They emphasised that the application can be removed by users. Congress had alleged the directive was dictatorial and called the app a snooping tool.
title: 'Chor ki daadhi mein tinka': BJP defends Sanchar Saathi app; jabs Cong over privacy row

author: DR. ARATI KULKARNI SRIVASTAVA
description: Ciara graces the cover of Remix Magazine, discussing her new album "CiCi" and two decades in music. The interview highlights her creative independence and first project on her own label. The accompanying photoshoot showcases her commanding presence in a series of powerful business and fashion-forward looks against the New York City skyline.
title: Ciara brings ‘sassy and saucy’ vibes to NYC photoshoot for Remix Magazine

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Delhi's domestic cricket woes deepened with a historic 12-run loss to Tripura in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. Chasing 158, Delhi's batting faltered on a slow pitch, finishing at 145 for 8. Indrajit Debnath's crucial last-over bowling secured Tripura's maiden win against Delhi, raising questions about team selection.
title: Delhi derailed: Tripura defeats star-studded side in Syed Mushtaq; script history

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Imran Khan's sister, Uzma Khanum, confirmed the former Pakistan PM is "completely fine" after a rare jail visit. Weeks of restricted access had sparked protests and death rumours. Despite court orders, family and party leaders faced repeated denials, leading to legal challenges and allegations of police brutality against protesting sisters. PTI seeks regular, unhindered access.
title: 'Imran alive, mentally tortured': Sister Uzma meets jailed leader; big charge against Munir

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Which brings us to Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth and the now-infamous “Kill Them All” directive. The mainstream American commentariat is working overtime to portray his alleged order — to eliminate the two survivors clinging to the wreckage of a bombed Caribbean vessel — as a shocking departure from established norms. But the truth is far less flattering. The Caribbean strike is not a fracture in American conduct. It is the logical expression of it. It is not an aberration. It is a revelation.
title: 'Kill them all': Pete Hegseth's order is a feature of America's cowboy justice

author: SMRITI JAIN
description: Indian stock markets are poised for a constructive 2026, driven by an improving earnings cycle, strong domestic liquidity, and normalizing valuations, says Ajay Menon, MD & CEO – Wealth Management, Motilal Oswal Financial Services. Which sectors should investors focus on? Will other emerging markets and even gold continue to outperform Indian equity benchmarks in 2026 as well?
title: Sensex vs Gold: What should you opt for in 2026? Here’s the outlook

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Fourteen-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi became the youngest centurion in Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy history, scoring an unbeaten 108 for Bihar. His remarkable innings, however, wasn't enough as Maharashtra, led by Prithvi Shaw's 66, chased down Bihar's total to secure a victory. The result gave Maharashtra their second win from four matches in the group.
title: Suryavanshi hits 3rd T20 ton, but fastest-to-three record belongs to someone else

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: China has issued new general export licenses for rare earth shipments, easing months of disruption caused by tighter controls. This move, following the Trump-Xi summit, allows year-long permits for specific customers, particularly in the auto sector. While easing some pressures, differences remain between Beijing and Washington regarding the extent of these changes.
title: Trade reset: China issues rare earth licences; questions persist over wider access

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Zoho's chief, Sridhar Vembu, has passionately responded to the forecasts made by Y Combinator's Garry Tan, which suggest that AI's 'vibe coding' could extinguish the flame of Indian SaaS innovators. Vembu emphasized the strong trajectory of Zoho's customer base, casting doubt on the effectiveness of AI-generated applications for the nuanced requirements of businesses and raising alarms about potential technological debt.
title: 'AI will destroy Zoho' - American investor Garry Tan; Vembu challenges him to bet

author: TNN
title: Air India plane flies without certificate; DGCA launches probe

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Investors who followed Michael Saylor's Bitcoin strategy are now facing heavy losses. Strategy Inc.'s stock has seen a sharp decline, causing leveraged funds tied to it to unwind. This has erased previous gains and is impacting asset retention for funds tracking the company's volatile Bitcoin bets.
title: Bitcoin meltdown: Strategy stock tanks over 60%; retail ETF wipe-outs spark fresh fears

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: OpenAI faces an internal 'code red' as Google's Gemini surges ahead, forcing a halt on revenue plans to fix ChatGPT's performance. Google's integrated infrastructure and custom chips give it a decisive edge. OpenAI's pivot highlights intense competition and financial pressures, as it scrambles to regain ground against a resurgent tech giant.
title: 'Code Red' at OpenAI: CEO Altman warns staff - leave everything, make ChatGPT better

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Deadlock over? Oppn gets its way; Parliament to debate electoral reforms

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma acknowledges Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's significant impact on India's lineup, despite facing them before. He highlighted their crucial roles in the first ODI and expressed a desire for more high-quality bilateral series against top nations, humorously noting players' aging concerns.
title: IND vs SA: 'I was in school when Rohit Sharma played the 2007 T20 World Cup', says Temba Bavuma

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Imran Khan's sister, Uzma Khanum, met the former Pakistan PM in Adiala Jail after weeks of denied access, sparking protests. Family and PTI had faced repeated visit curbs despite court orders. Concerns over Khan's health intensified amid unverified death rumours and alleged police assault on protesting sisters.
title: Pak govt buckles: Imran Khan's sister meets jailed leader; massive stirs continue

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Pakistan accused India of delaying its humanitarian aid to Sri Lanka, claiming airspace permission was withheld. India refuted these allegations, stating the request was processed within four hours. Meanwhile, Pakistan's High Commission in Sri Lanka faced online criticism over relief packages with apparent near-expiry dates.
title: Sri Lanka aid: Pak blames India again; mocked online for giving 'expired' relief

author: etimes.in
description: Rupali Ganguly, Gaurav Khanna's former co-star from 'Anupamaa', has publicly backed him for the Bigg Boss 19 finale. While praising other contestants, Ganguly declared Khanna deserves to win the trophy. This support comes amidst past rumors of a rift between the two actors.
title: BB19: Amid speculation of a fallout, Rupali Ganguly extends her support to Gaurav Khanna

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: India's primary market is set for a massive year-end, with December poised to raise nearly Rs 30,000 crore from around 25 IPOs. Major listings like ICICI Prudential AMC and Meesho are leading the charge. This surge, fueled by strong business confidence and discerning investors, signals robust market momentum extending into 2026.
title: IPO boom continues! December set to be another big month - What's on the list?

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma downplayed his coach's "grovel" comment, stating it wasn't a distraction for the team. Bavuma acknowledged the strength Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma bring to India's ODI side, noting their familiarity but also their significant experience. He also highlighted Marco Jansen's valuable all-round contributions and expressed a desire for more Test matches against top nations.
title: 'Not for me to clarify': Bavuma plays down 'Grovel' remark; calls for more Tests against India

author: LACHIT ROY
description: Wrestling legend Ric Flair's claims about Hulk Hogan's final days, suggesting "street drugs" were involved, have been vehemently denied by Hogan's widow, Sky Daily. She insists Hogan was under close medical supervision and disputes Flair's account of their last conversation. Flair later apologized, citing misinformation, but the incident has sparked debate.
title: Ric Flair retracts claim on Hulk Hogan’s death after widow immediately denies it

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: SIR pause in Kerala? SC asks EC for reply; hearing on Dec 8

author: BARSHA DUTTA
description: Donald Trump's recent golf outing, featuring a chip-in shot and a claim of 38 club championships, has reignited discussions about his golfing prowess. Playing alongside legends like Wayne Gretzky and Brooks Koepka, Trump's performance and boasts, including a victory over a younger player, continue to fuel his athletic narrative, drawing both admiration and skepticism from observers.
title: Trump’s flashy golf moment with Wayne Gretzky sparks debate on his 38 titles

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Vivo has unveiled its flagship X300 series in India, featuring the X300 and X300 Pro. These smartphones boast impressive camera systems, including a 50MP front camera and ZEISS collaboration for enhanced photography. With powerful MediaTek chipsets and Android 16, they offer distinct imaging experiences and premium features, available from December 10, 2025.
title: Vivo X300, X300 Pro launch: Sports Zeiss camera, IP68+IP69 rating - check details

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi commented on Renuka Chowdhury bringing a stray dog to Parliament, stating pets are not allowed outside but "inside." Gandhi's remarks drew criticism from the BJP, who accused him of comparing opposition leaders to dogs. Chowdhury had brought the puppy after finding it near Parliament.
title: 'What did poor dog do?' Rahul mocks row over pup in Parliament; BJP hits back

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: SoftBank CEO Masayoshi Son has revealed a painful decision to sell Nvidia shares.  The sale, worth billions, was necessary to fund aggressive new investments in artificial intelligence.  Son expressed regret over the divestment but remains confident in the long-term potential of AI.  He dismissed concerns about an AI investment bubble, emphasizing its transformative economic impact.
title: When ChatGPT made Japan's second-richest man, Softbank CEO Masayoshi Son 'cry'

author: AADRITA HALDER
description: India's Air Quality Index (AQI) translates pollution levels into health risks, classifying air quality into six categories. PM2.5, a key pollutant, deeply impacts lungs and bloodstream, with levels of 200 causing noticeable stress and 500 leading to severe complications. Vulnerable groups like children and the elderly face heightened risks.
title: When pollution crosses the line: AQI 500 vs AQI 200 — what these numbers mean for your lungs

author: VENKADESAN S
description: A deep depression, a remnant of Cyclone Ditwah, has turned back towards the east coast, prompting a red alert for Chennai and neighboring districts.  Extremely heavy rainfall is expected in northern Tamil Nadu. The system is currently very close to the coast and is forecast to weaken before making landfall south of Chennai.
title: Cyclone Ditwah: Deep depression U-turns towards East Coast; red alert issued for Chennai

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: The central government has clarified it is not considering merging dearness allowance (DA) with basic pay for employees and pensioners. This comes as unions demand an interim merger due to rising inflation.
title: 8th Pay Commission update: Centre breaks silence on basic pay–DA merger; key details

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Chinese electronics giants like Oppo and Vivo are increasingly relying on loans from their group companies to fund Indian operations. This shift to external commercial borrowings (ECBs) stems from roadblocks in securing equity funding due to Press Note 3 (PN3) rules and regulatory actions, making bank loans difficult. The funding challenges are impacting expansion plans for some firms.
title: 'Equity capital dried up': Chinese electronic brands reel under India's regulatory hurdle

author: JYOTIRMOY HALDER
description: Uzbekistan's 19-year-old Javokhir Sindarov made chess history by becoming the youngest FIDE World Cup champion, earning a spot in the 2026 Candidates Tournament.  Kazakhstan's Grandmaster Bibisara Assaubayeva, a two-time World Blitz Champion, expressed immense pride in Sindarov's achievement.  Assaubayeva, who will play for American Gambits in the upcoming season of GCL, now aims to qualify for the Women's Candidates next year.
title: Exclusive: Sindarov wins WC in Goa; 'closest friend' Assaubayeva targets her 'unfinished task'

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: India's third indigenous nuclear-powered submarine is set for commissioning soon, announced Navy chief Admiral Dinesh K Tripathi. He also detailed how Operation Sindoor's aggressive naval action forced Pakistan's forces to remain near their coast. The Navy's extensive operations over the past year, including continuous anti-piracy duties and significant ship and flying hours, were also highlighted.
title: 'Forced Pak ships to stay in ports': Navy chief on Op Sindoor; fleet on full alert

author: TIMESOFINDIA.COM
description: OpenAI is reportedly testing ads within the free version of ChatGPT, a significant shift from its ad-free model. This move aims to create a new revenue stream, potentially integrating commerce directly into the AI chatbot.  Code references in the Android app suggest ads may appear soon, impacting the web economy by leveraging user data for personalized promotions.
title: Free version of ChatGPT, as it is right now, may be coming to an end soon

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Hardik Pandya made a strong comeback to competitive cricket. He scored an unbeaten 77 to guide Baroda to a seven-wicket win against Punjab. Baroda chased down 223 runs. Pandya finished the match with three consecutive sixes. This marks an encouraging return after his injury.
title: Pandya’s blazing 77* powers Baroda to record chase; fan breaks security cordon - watch

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Supreme Court questioned the obligation to illegal entrants during a hearing on Rohingya disappearances. The court asked if 'intruders' should receive a 'red carpet welcome'. The bench emphasized that if individuals lack legal status, deportation is a valid consideration. The court pondered the implications of illegal entry followed by demands for legal protections.
title: 'Red carpet for intruders?' SC's sharp stance on Rohingya plea; questions legal basis

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Team India has arrived in Raipur for the second ODI against South Africa, holding a 1-0 series lead. A video of Virat Kohli and selector Pragyan Ojha in an intense airport conversation has sparked fan speculation. Kohli's match-winning 135 in the first ODI was crucial to India's victory.
title: What's cooking? Kohli seen having serious conversation with India selector ahead of 2nd ODI - watch

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Rajasthan CID Intelligence apprehended Prakash Singh alias Badal from Firozpur for allegedly spying for Pakistan's ISI. He was caught transmitting sensitive Indian Army information from Rajasthan, Punjab, and Gujarat to Pakistani handlers via social media. Singh also facilitated ISI agents in using Indian SIM cards for espionage by providing OTPs, receiving monetary compensation for his actions.
title: WhatsApp spy held in Rajasthan: Pak agent traced near military zone; army routes, data, OTPs leaked

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Pakistan's High Commission in Sri Lanka drew online flak for its relief material photos, with critics questioning the origin of the biscuits shown. Meanwhile, India swiftly denied blocking Pakistan's airspace for aid delivery, confirming an overflight request was approved promptly on Monday. This highlights a diplomatic exchange amidst Sri Lanka's flood crisis.
title: Did Pakistan send expired aid to flood-hit Sri Lanka? Social media pokes fun

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Elon Musk believes artificial intelligence and robotics can solve America's debt crisis in three years. He argues technology-led growth will outpace inflation and debt. This could lead to increased production and economic output. Musk suggests this transformation will reduce reliance on human labor. It offers a path to abundance, easing fiscal burdens without painful cuts.
title: Musk’s vision: Bets big on AI, robots; claims to solve America's debt crisis in 3 yrs

author: AP
description: Japan's Princess Aiko, widely popular, faces a male-only succession law that prevents her from becoming empress. With the monarchy shrinking, supporters urge reform to allow her to ascend the throne, highlighting her intelligence and public service. Despite growing calls for change, conservative opposition remains.
title: Princess Aiko’s popularity sparks calls to change Japan’s male-only succession law

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: JD(U) MLA Vibha Devi faced difficulty reading her oath at the Bihar Vidhan Sabha's inaugural session. Other newly elected legislators shared their plans for the state. The NDA secured a significant victory in the recent elections, winning over 200 seats. BJP emerged as the largest party, followed by JD(U). Opposition parties like RJD and Congress secured fewer seats.
title: First-day jitters in Bihar assembly: JD(U)’s Vibha Devi fumbles reading oath lines

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Gold prices saw a dip on Tuesday. Traders decided to book profits after recent gains. This pullback ended a strong run for the yellow metal. Domestic prices mirrored global market movements. Gold futures on Comex also slipped. Analysts suggest this correction is due to profit-taking after prices reached multi-week highs. Investors are anticipating a US interest rate cut.
title: Gold price today: How much 18K, 22K gold costs in your city? Check rates

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and Deputy CM D.K. Shivakumar showcased unity after their second breakfast meeting, asserting they will govern together. Amid leadership speculation, they pledged to follow the high command's decisions and unite MLAs against the opposition. Discussions also covered farmer issues and the upcoming assembly session.
title: 'If high-command calls ...': DKS, Siddaramaiah show united front; inside breakfast meet 2.0

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Indian refiners are now securing non-sanctioned Russian crude at attractive discounts, with some deals fetching $5 per barrel below Dated Brent. This strategic shift follows US sanctions on major Russian oil firms. While overall imports remain controlled, select companies are resuming purchases, navigating evolving sanctions and ongoing trade discussions with Washington.
title: Love for Russian oil: India picks non-sanctioned crude at discounts; will Moscow remain top supplier?

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Singapore's ministry of education will require secondary students to keep smartphones and smartwatches locked away throughout the school day from January 2026. This expanded restriction aims to curb digital distractions and promote healthier screen habits by ensuring devices are stored away during all school activities.
title: No phones, no smartwatches: Singapore tightens school rules

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The government clarified that the Sanchar Saathi App can be deleted by users, stating their role was only to introduce it. This statement followed a political uproar over the mandatory pre-installation of the app on mobile handsets, with the opposition raising privacy concerns and likening it to a 'snooping app'.
title: Sanchar Saathi App row: Can you delete it? Centre's big clarification after oppn's 'snooping' charge

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Telecom Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia clarified that the Sanchar Saathi app is optional and can be deleted by users, refuting claims of mandatory pre-installation and disabling. The app aims to prevent cyber threats and track lost or stolen phones, not for snooping. This clarification follows a Reuters report about a government order for major smartphone companies.
title: Sanchar Saathi row: Telecom minister Scindia issues big clarification

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Fourteen-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi etched his name in history by becoming the youngest centurion in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. He smashed an unbeaten 108 off 61 balls against Maharashtra at Eden Gardens, showcasing a remarkable blend of patience and power.
title: SMAT: Vaibhav Suryavanshi creates history; blasts record-breaking century

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Virat Kohli reached Raipur for the second ODI against South Africa. He scored 135 runs in the first match. Young fans greeted him warmly at the hotel. India won the first ODI by 17 runs. Kohli's century and bowlers' performance were key. Their future World Cup selection may depend on playing the Vijay Hazare Trophy.
title: 'What a welcome!': Virat Kohli showered with red flowers by young fans in Raipur – Watch

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Bajaj Housing Finance shares hit a 52-week low on Tuesday following reports of a block deal where promoter Bajaj Finance is believed to have offloaded a 2.35% stake. Despite steady financial performance and an 18% profit rise in Q2FY26, the stock has fallen 23% since its September 2024 listing.
title: Bajaj Housing Finance share tumbles 9% to hit 52-week low - what triggered the fall?

author: VENKADESAN S
description: Around 25 commuters were stranded in a Chennai metro train for nearly 30 minutes in an underground tunnel early Tuesday. The train stopped due to a dual battery failure in its controlling units, forcing passengers to walk to the High Court station. Normal operations resumed shortly after.
title: Faulty batteries, no backup: How Chennai Metro plunged into early-morning chaos; video goes viral

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Australian all-rounder Glenn Maxwell has withdrawn from the IPL 2026 auction, concluding his impactful league journey. This decision follows a disappointing IPL 2025 season with Punjab Kings, where he scored only 48 runs in seven matches. Maxwell's exit joins a trend of prominent overseas players opting out of the upcoming tournament.
title: Glenn Maxwell opts out of IPL 2026; pens emotional goodbye to fans

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Gold price prediction: Gold prices are poised for a near-term rise, driven by surging expectations of a Federal Reserve rate cut and ongoing economic concerns. Analysts highlight strong ETF inflows and a potential all-time high for gold, while silver also shows significant gains amid inventory shortages and a favorable gold-silver ratio.
title: Gold price prediction: Will prices rise in the near-term? Top factors to keep in mind

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Former India coach Ravi Shastri expressed deep disappointment over the team's recent Test cricket decline, urging both players and management to accept responsibility. He highlighted a dramatic collapse in the Guwahati Test as an example of the team's underperformance, stating that such results are unacceptable given the talent available in the country.
title: 'I'd take the blame': Shastri blasts India's Test slide under Gambhir

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Pakistan's former Prime Minister Imran Khan's prolonged isolation has sparked fears of his death, with his party demanding access.  Despite government restrictions and Section 144 enforcement, PTI plans protests outside Islamabad High Court and Adiala Jail.  Khan's family reports no verifiable contact, fearing the worst.  Officials deny rumors of his demise or transfer, stating he is in stable condition and receiving care in Adiala Jail.
title: Imran Khan supporters plan major protest in Rawalpindi amid death rumours — 10 things to know

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Ranveer Singh has apologized for remarks made at IFFI 2025, where he mistakenly referred to a goddess as a 'female ghost' while praising Rishabh Shetty's 'Kantara' performance. Hindu groups filed a complaint, alleging insult to Goddess Chamundadevi. Singh clarified his intent was admiration and expressed deep respect for all beliefs, offering a sincere apology for any hurt caused.
title: Ranveer Singh apologises over claims he insulted Goddess Chamundadevi in ‘Kantara 1’

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Indian government's mandate for pre-installing the Sanchar Saathi app on all mobile devices has ignited a political firestorm. While the Department of Telecommunications cites curbing IMEI misuse and strengthening cybersecurity, opposition parties decry it as a 'snooping app' and an unconstitutional privacy breach, fearing government surveillance.
title: Sanchar Saathi App dictum: Centre calls it safety measure, oppn calls it 'snooping app'

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A 23 year old Saudi student, Hamza Albar, was praised for his bravery after stopping an attempted rape in Sunderland, UK. On December 30, 2024, he chased, caught, and restrained attacker Ian Hodson, despite being punched, until police arrived. Hodson was sentenced to nine years in prison. Northumbria Police and the courts lauded Albar’s courageous intervention.
title: Saudi student praised for bravely stopping attempted rape in Sunderland (UK), attacker sentenced

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Nvidia downplays competition from Google in AI hardware, asserting its industry-leading position despite reports of Meta potentially spending billions on Google's custom chips. This news, coupled with Meta's potential shift, has caused Nvidia's stock to fall, highlighting increasing competition in the AI race.
title: 'Still a generation ahead': Nvidia downplays chip war with Google; asserts hardware industry dominance

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: A woman's routine street food stop in Uttar Pradesh took a painful turn when her jaw dislocated while eating a golgappa. The incident, captured on video, left her mouth stuck open and required referral to a higher medical facility. Experts now urge caution with oversized snacks to prevent similar painful jaw dislocations.
title: UP woman’s golgappa bite leads to shocking jaw dislocation emergency

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed deep concern and offered support for former Bangladesh PM Khaleda Zia, who is in critical condition. The Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) conveyed sincere gratitude for Modi's thoughtful message and goodwill. Zia, a prominent political figure, is currently on ventilation at a Dhaka hospital due to a deteriorating health condition.
title: Bangladesh: BNP hails PM Modi's concern for critical former PM Khaleda Zia

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Chennai Metro commuters experienced significant disruption Tuesday morning as a train stalled between High Court and Central Metro stations due to a technical fault, suspected to be a power failure. Passengers were left stranded for a period before normal services were restored by 6:20 am, easing the flow on the affected route.
title: Chennai Metro faces disruption: Train halts between Central & HC station; power glitch suspected

author: Agencies
description: European leaders rallied behind Ukrainian President Zelenskyy, supporting his peace proposal revisions after US-Ukrainian talks. While US envoy Steve Witkoff heads to Moscow to brief the Kremlin, Russia continues its attacks on Ukrainian cities, claiming territorial gains amidst ongoing negotiations.
title: Europeans rally round Ukraine, Trump envoy heads to Moscow

author: CHIDANAND RAJGHATTA
description: Apple has hired Google veteran Amar Subramanya as its new VP of AI to bolster its lagging ambitions. Subramanya, who previously led AI efforts at Microsoft, brings expertise in foundation models and machine learning. This move highlights the intense talent war in Silicon Valley as Apple seeks to catch up with rivals in the AI race.
title: From hey Siri to hey Subbu? Apple hires Amar Subramanya, taking a bite out of Google via Microsoft

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Abhimanyu Easwaran is a consistent performer in Indian domestic cricket. He has scored many runs in the Ranji Trophy. However, a Test debut remains elusive. Despite being in squads, he has been overlooked. Easwaran recently showed T20 aggression with a century. This has sparked discussion about his potential selection for the Test team.
title: 'He scored a hundred in T20… now he’ll play Tests': Ashwin takes sharp dig at Agarkar

author: TOI Education
description: The Karnataka Department of School Education has released the KARTET 2025 hall tickets for the December 7th examination. Candidates can download their admit cards online from sts.karnataka.gov.in and must carry a printed copy along with a valid photo ID to the exam centre. The admit card contains crucial details like exam centre, timing, and personal information.
title: Karnataka TET Hall Ticket 2025 out: Download admit card now

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A Manhattan judge reviewed crucial evidence in the murder case of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, including a 911 call from the McDonald's where Luigi Mangione was arrested. Prosecutors presented surveillance footage of the shooting. Mangione's defense is challenging the legality of the search and seizure of evidence, while supporters rallied outside.
title: ‘Looks like the CEO shooter’: 911 call by McDonald's worker played during Luigi Mangione hearing

author: RAUNAK BOSE
description: The Chicago Cubs are reportedly considering a blockbuster trade for Detroit Tigers ace Tarik Skubal, a two-time Cy Young winner, to fill the void left by Kyle Tucker's expected free agency departure. This move would create a formidable pitching duo with rookie Cade Horton and signal a serious World Series push for the Cubs.
title: MLB trade rumors: Cubs tipped to land $400M Tigers Cy Young winner in mega deal

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Virat Kohli's exceptional 135 against South Africa silenced form concerns. Former Proteas bowler Dale Steyn revealed Kohli's elite conditioning stems from training at top London facilities with a personal trainer. Kohli himself emphasized his mental approach and consistent physical fitness over excessive preparation, showcasing his professionalism.
title: 'Personal trainer, top-class facilities': Steyn reveals Kohli’s preparation routine in London

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Delhi High Court heard arguments over industrialist Sunjay Kapur's Rs 30,000 crore will. His mother, Rani Kapur, alleges his wife, Priya Kapur, rushed to control assets instead of mourning. Rani claims she was excluded from the will despite Sunjay's acknowledgment of her support. The court is also considering an injunction sought by Sunjay's children from his marriage to Karisma Kapoor.
title: Sanjay Kapur property feud: Instead of mourning, Priya sought control of assets, alleges Rani

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: A significant legal battle has erupted over the Rs 30,000 crore estate of the late Sunjay Kapur. His mother, Rani Kapur, has now joined Karisma Kapoor and her children in challenging Sunjay's will. Rani questions the will's authenticity, stating it's improbable Sunjay would disinherit his mother and leave everything to his widow, Priya Sachdev.
title: Sanjay Kapur's mother, Rani Kapur, supports Karisma

author: AFP
description: Following a fatal shooting near the White House, President Trump announced a prolonged pause on asylum decisions, particularly for nationals from 19 countries. He stated, "We don’t want those people," citing concerns about their suitability for entry. The incident involved an Afghan national, arrested and charged with murder, who had arrived under a resettlement program.
title: Trump says US freeze on asylum decisions will last ‘a long time’

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge slammed the Modi government for a fresh FIR in the National Herald case, calling it a political vendetta against the Gandhi family. The BJP countered, demanding explanations for alleged "loot by its leaders" and stating the case predates the current administration. The Congress maintains the ED is conducting a politically motivated witch hunt.
title: 'When facts ran thin, theatrics stepped in': Cong targets govt, ED over National Herald case

author: KUSHAGRA DIXIT
title: RML doctors see anxiety, cognitive fog linked to bad air

author: TNN
description: A software engineer, Shivam Arora, accused of causing a chef's death and injuring two others in a Mercedes G-63 crash, has been granted bail. Police stated the charges were bailable. The victim's family, devastated by the loss of their sole breadwinner, is demanding strict action and compensation, highlighting their shattered lives.
title: Delhi: Mercedes G-63 driver who killed chef, injured 2 gets bail; victim's family demands action

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Karnataka chief minister Siddaramaiah visited Deputy chief minister D K Shivakumar's residence for breakfast on December 2. This meeting follows recent discussions to strengthen their collective efforts for the state. The leaders aim to present a united front ahead of the Belagavi legislature session. This breakfast meeting signals a pause in the ongoing leadership discussions within the ruling party.
title: Breakfast meet 2.0: Karnataka power tussle still unsettled; DKS and Siddaramaiah hold meet again

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani denounced federal immigration raids as "cruel and inhumane," stating they do not enhance public safety. His comments followed a violent confrontation in lower Manhattan where protesters clashed with federal agents, leading to over a dozen arrests. Mamdani emphasized his commitment to protecting all city residents, including immigrants.
title: ‘Cruel, inhumane’: Mamdani slams ICE raids; reveals what he told Trump when he met him

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Tuesday on weak global cues. While Nifty50 was above 26,150, BSE Sensex was near 85,500.
title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in red; BSE Sensex near 85,500

author: ARANI BASU
description: Former selectors and experts urge Indian cricket to end the constant scrutiny of Rohit and Virat, highlighting their continued capability. Despite recent performances, the team management's approach to the 2027 World Cup preparation, particularly regarding the captaincy transition, has caused unease. Clear communication and a defined plan are crucial for the veterans and the team's future.
title: These guys deserve better! Ex-selectors say Rohit & Virat must stop being put on trial

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Stock market recommendations: Investors can consider buying Ashok Leyland, HCL Tech, and Bank of Baroda on December 2, 2025.  Ashok Leyland is expected to break a triangle pattern upwards. HCL Tech is poised to resume its uptrend after consolidation. Bank of Baroda is showing a range breakout with positive momentum.
title: Top stocks to buy: Stock market recommendations for today - check list

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: In a world increasingly dominated by artificial intelligence, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella argues that emotional intelligence is essential for business leaders. He posits that while AI can manage technical tasks, the human touch—through empathy and collaboration—remains irreplaceable in driving success.
title: Workplace success: Satya Nadella says 'can't rely on brains alone'; reveals 'best tool'

author: RAHUL SINGH
description: A rape survivor has approached the Supreme Court to cancel Asaram Bapu's bail, granted on medical grounds by Rajasthan and Gujarat High Courts. The survivor's counsel argues that the 84-year-old godman is traveling and not seriously ill, misusing court relief. A medical board previously found his condition stable, not requiring hospitalization.
title: Rape survivor moves SC seeking cancellation of Asaram Bapu’s bail

author: PRANTIK PRABAL ROY
description: Former executive Gord Stellick questions Auston Matthews' captaincy, suggesting leadership and talent are not synonymous. He believes the team lost its compass after the shift, with John Tavares' quiet professionalism now seen as a potential stabilizing force. The current leadership faces a critical test to steer the team back to resilience.
title: Matthews’ captaincy questioned as ex-GM hints Leafs picked the wrong leader

author: SAMAD HOQUE
description: Banks may face liability for cyber fraud losses if "due diligence" is found lacking, Haryana DGP OP Singh stated. Investigations will determine bank accountability for customer compensation.  The DGP also highlighted measures for faster release of frozen funds and an expanded awareness campaign involving students as cyber ambassadors.
title: Cyberfraud: Banks could be liable; authorities push lok adalat route for quick relief

author: AJAY SURA
description: Punjab government strongly opposed Amritpal Singh's temporary release to attend Parliament, fearing his speeches could destabilize the state.  The High Court has ordered the government to present specific evidence justifying the denial of his request. Amritpal is currently jailed under the NSA in Assam.
title: 'One speech could set fire': Punjab opposes Amritpal's temporary release; hearing on Dec 8

author: RAJ SHEKHAR JHA
description: In a significant shift, the Baloch Liberation Front deployed a female suicide bomber, Zareena Rafiq, to attack a Chinese-linked mining complex in Balochistan. This marks the BLF's first use of a fidayeen operative, a tactic previously exclusive to the BLA.
title: BLF claims it used woman fidayeen to storm Pak FC HQ; site tied to Chinese project

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Despite an ODI win, coach Gautam Gambhir faces intense fan criticism after a Test series whitewash.  Former player Zaheer Khan advises Gambhir to develop resilience and communicate transparently with supporters regarding team strategies and selections to manage rising expectations and frustration.
title: 'Emotions run high': 2011 World Cup winner’s blunt reminder to Gambhir as criticism mounts

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Brokerages offer mixed views on Indian stocks. HSBC is bullish on GAIL, Jefferies on Kfin Tech, and Kotak on Swiggy. Citigroup, however, rates Laurus Laboratories a sell. Goldman Sachs maintains a neutral stance on Jubilant Foodworks, citing growth potential and margin expansion opportunities.
title: GAIL, Swiggy & more: Top stocks to buy on December 2 — check list

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: An Indigo flight en route from Kuwait to Hyderabad made an emergency landing at Mumbai Airport on Tuesday due to a bomb threat. Passengers were safely evacuated as security and bomb disposal teams responded. Authorities are currently investigating the incident, with further details pending.
title: IndiGo bomb scare: Kuwait-Hyderabad flight diverted to Mumbai; probe launched

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Over 1,300 players, including prominent Indian and international stars, have registered for the IPL mini-auction in Abu Dhabi, setting the stage for intense bidding. With 77 slots available and teams holding substantial funds, the December 16 event promises a thrilling competition for coveted IPL contracts.
title: IPL auction: 1,355 players register for 77 slots; event on December 16

author: SHISHIR ARYA
description: A former BrahMos Aerospace scientist, Nishant Agarwal, has been cleared of espionage and cyber terrorism charges by the Bombay High Court. While exonerated of passing missile secrets, he was convicted for possessing classified information on a personal device, receiving a three-year sentence. Having already served longer, his release is anticipated.
title: Nishant Agarwal to walk free in BrahMos spy case; Pak’s ‘Neha’, ‘Pooja’ targeted more scientists

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu and filmmaker Raj Nidimoru exchanged vows in a sacred Bhuta Shuddhi Vivaha ceremony at the Isha Yoga Center. The 'Citadel' couple celebrated their union with close friends and family, later sharing joyous glimpses of the intimate event, including their traditional vegetarian thali reception.
title: Samantha-Raj wedding: Friend shares inside pics

author: PRIYANGI AGARWAL
description: A CSE analysis reveals Delhi-NCR's early winter pollution spikes are closely linked to traffic emissions, with PM2.5 and nitrogen dioxide rising in tandem. Persistent carbon monoxide exceedances highlight ongoing vehicular pollution, even as farm fire contributions decrease. The report urges a focus on cleaner vehicles and fuels to combat the elevated, plateauing pollution levels.
title: Winter pain: How Delhi’s pollution spikes are mirroring traffic hours

author: PAYAL DHAWAN
description: A 32-year-old businessman tragically died shielding his family during a wedding shootout in Ludhiana, where around 30 rounds were fired. The incident, described as a fight for supremacy between local criminals, resulted in two deaths, including the groom's aunt. Prime accused Shubham Arora remains at large, while Ankur has been arrested.
title: 'Mainu apne naal leja': Bizman dies trying to save family in Ludhiana; three security guards arrested

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana and composer Palash Muchhal's November 23 wedding has been postponed due to unexpected family health emergencies. Mandhana's father and groom-to-be Muchhal were hospitalized, leading to the decision. Both are now recovering, but a new date is yet to be announced. Friend Jemimah Rodrigues has withdrawn from WBBL to support Mandhana.
title: Smriti Mandhana wedding postponed: Has Palash Muchhal also deleted Instagram posts?

author: PRANTIK PRABAL ROY
description: New York Giants rookie quarterback Jaxson Dart's sparkling necklace is more than just an accessory; it's a cherished gift from his sister. This meaningful charm, worn for every game, symbolizes family, faith, and a reminder to spread love and joy. Dart views it as a powerful connection to home, grounding him amidst the NFL's spotlight.
title: Why Giants rookie Jaxson Dart wears eye black and his signature chain ritual

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Amazon Web Services and Google Cloud have launched a joint multicloud networking service to enhance internet reliability and speed up connections between platforms. This collaboration aims to reduce costly service disruptions, with early adopters like Salesforce already utilizing the new interoperable approach. The move highlights a growing need for seamless connectivity even among major cloud competitors.
title: Internet outages fallout: Google and Amazon join hands; here’s what it means

author: NEEL KAMAL
description: Punjab has achieved a significant reduction in stubble burning, with no districts in the top 10 worst offenders this year. Madhya Pradesh now leads, reporting the highest number of cases. This turnaround follows strict measures and behavioral changes among farmers in Punjab and Haryana, while other states have become new hotspots.
title: No Punjab district in farm-fire top 10; MP leads

author: TNN
description: The Supreme Court has adopted a more lenient stance on bail for life convicts, stating that release is possible during appeal if acquittal appears likely. Applying this, a Tamil Nadu police officer convicted in a custodial death case was granted bail.
title: Can give life convict bail during pendency of appeal if he has a fair chance of acquittal: SC

author: VENKADESAN S
description: Cyclone Ditwah, after weakening, surprised Chennai with a deluge on Monday morning, causing widespread flooding and traffic disruptions. The India Meteorological Department issued orange and red alerts for the city and Tiruvallur respectively. Weathermen predict continued heavy rain for the region as the system lingers offshore.
title: Cyclone Ditwah: Chennai, suburbs wake to season’s wettest morning; schools, colleges closed

author: YOGITA RAO
description: Over 20 companies have been banned from participating in the IIT placement season for revoking job offers made to students, some as late as June or July. This decision was made unanimously by IITs to protect students' career prospects and mental well-being. The banned firms can still recruit through off-campus processes.
title: IITs bar from placement drive 20+ companies that rescinded offers

author: TNN
description: November GST collections saw modest growth after a significant rate overhaul, with the government highlighting increased consumption as a positive sign. While domestic revenue dipped slightly, import collections rose, and net collections improved due to lower refunds. Officials expressed optimism that these trends indicate a sustainable reform with a future multiplier effect.
title: Rate rejig: GST collection growth moderates in November

author: DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA
title: Show results of anti-pollution steps: SC to Centre, NCR govts

author: SANDEEP RAI
description: Eight election workers have died in Uttar Pradesh during intensive revision duties in just ten days, including three suicides. A headmaster in Sambhal succumbed to a heart attack, with his family citing immense work pressure. Officials are facing scrutiny as teachers, often deployed due to manpower shortages, bear the brunt of demanding electoral tasks.
title: SIR: UP headmaster dies of heart attack; toll rises to 8 in 10 days

author: ABHINAV GARG
description: A bitter inheritance battle has erupted over industrialist Sunjay Kapur's Rs 30,000-crore estate. His mother, Rani Kapur, has joined forces with his ex-wife Karisma Kapoor, challenging the validity of his will. They allege Sunjay's wife, Priya, is attempting to seize assets and question the will's authenticity, claiming it omits key family members and assets.
title: Sunjay Kapur property row: Not mentioned in will, mother Rani Kapur joins forces with Karisma Kapoor

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: 'Tere Ishk Mein' is performing impressively at the box office, maintaining strong collections despite a weekend dip. The romantic drama starring Dhanush and Kriti Sanon has garnered significant audience appreciation, evident in its steady footfalls across major cities and positive word-of-mouth. The film's success marks a new milestone for Dhanush, becoming his highest-earning Hindi venture.
title: ‘Tere Ishk Mein’ box office: Dhanush-Kriti film sees 50% drop on first Monday

author: AMISHA PANDEY
description: Following a crushing UNC loss, Bill Belichick's gesture of giving his coat to girlfriend Jordon Hudson sparked a social media storm. While some saw a sweet, gentlemanly act, others criticized the timing and optics, especially given the team's performance and their relationship's public scrutiny. This small moment overshadowed the game's outcome, highlighting the intense focus on Belichick and Hudson.
title: Bill Belichick’s romantic moment with Jordon Hudson after UNC loss steals spotlight

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Indian cricketer Jemimah Rodrigues deactivated WhatsApp after receiving a thousand messages post her semi-final heroics in the Women's World Cup.  Overwhelmed by the attention while preparing for the final, she disconnected from digital platforms to maintain focus. This highlights the immense public interest in women's cricket and the challenges athletes face managing newfound fame.
title: ‘I couldn’t take it’: Jemimah reveals why she deleted WhatsApp post-World Cup; cites privacy

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Virat Kohli's magnificent 52nd ODI century, a blistering 135, powered India to 349 against South Africa. A crucial partnership with Rohit Sharma underscored their enduring class.  While Kohli celebrated his 83rd international ton, Arshdeep Singh humorously revealed Rohit's quirky reaction.  Discussions about their 2027 World Cup future are ongoing, with potential domestic tournaments and BCCI meetings planned.
title: IND vs SA: Arshdeep reveals what Rohit said during his animated reaction after Kohli's ton - Watch
